trial_identification.studytitle: Facing the Fear: An Investigation of Factors Influencing Homework Adherence in the Treatment of Adults with Anxiety Disorders
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Investigation of therapeutic outcomes and homework adherence associated with electronic homework reminders, among adult outpatients suffering an anxiety disorder.

conditions.healthcondition: Agoraphobia Without History of Panic Disorder

interventions.interventions: This study will be examining the use electronic homework reminder messages, delivered to participants via mobile phone text messaging. The messages will be tested in an outpatient group therapy setting. Treatment will consist of 9 two hour group therapy sessions conducted weekly, based on the Unified Protocol for Transdiagnostic Treatment of Emotional Disorders. Both groups will have access to between session tasks to be completed by paper and pen. The intervention group will receive SMS messages from their therapists throughout the week, reminding them of homework tasks and providing tips. The standard treatment group will not receive SMS messages.
interventions.comparator: The control group will receive the same 9 week group therapy programme. All therapy and activities will be equivalent. The control group will receive homework tasks in the standard pen and paper format rather than electronically.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Homework adherence will be measured by scores on the Homework Rating Scales developed by Westra and Dozois, and Kazantzis and Colleagues.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Patient and therapist versions of these scales will be completed each week during the eight week trial.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule - Adult Version to assess diagnostic criteria and clinical severity.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered pre-treatment, post treatment, and six months following completion of treatment.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Symptoms of Depression and Anxiety as measured by the Depression and Anxiety Stress Scales 21.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered pre-treatment, post treatment, and six months following completion of treatment.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Symptoms of distress as measured by the Outcome Questionnaire 45.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered pre-treatment, post treatment, and six months following completion of treatment.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Affect - as measured by the Positive and Negative Affect Scales.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered pre-treatment, post treatment, and six months following completion of treatment.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Impairment in Functioning - as measured by the Work and Social Adjustment Scale.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered pre-treatment, post-treatment, and at six month follow up.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Working Alliance - as measured by the Working Alliance Inventory - Short Revised.
Group Climate - as measured by the Group Climate Questionnaire.
Group Cohesion - as measured by the cohesiveness subscale of the Therapeutic Factors Inventory.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: A clinical diagnosis of an Anxiety Disorder found in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition, Text Revised. Diagnosis will be assessed using the ADIS-L structured interview.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Current diagnosis, or history of, mania, psychosis, substance dependence, or recurring suicidal ideation.

trial_design.concealment: Allocation is concealed based on central randomization by a computer.
trial_design.sequence: Participants who meet criteria for inclusion in the study will be randomly allocated to conditions, according to simple randomization procedures - computerized random numbers created by ClinTools software (Devilly, 2007).

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of this study is to investigate the use of a therapeutic Smartphone application in the delivery of thearpy homework. It is expected that the electronic delivery of homeowrk tasks will facilitate greater patient adherence with these tasks, when compared to pen and paper delivery.
